title: Getting Started as a Student Assistant

sections.heading: Welcome to AI Engagement Hub
sections.content: As a Student Assistant, you play a vital role in supporting your peers and helping them navigate AI-assisted learning. This position allows you to develop leadership skills while assisting both students and instructors.

sections.heading: Understanding Your Role
sections.content: Student Assistants bridge the gap between students and instructors, providing peer support and basic administrative assistance.

subsections.heading: Core Responsibilities
subsections.content: Help fellow students with platform navigation. Answer basic questions about AI usage. Report technical issues to instructors. Assist with peer learning activities.

subsections.heading: Your Permissions
subsections.content: Access to view class-wide usage statistics. Ability to help moderate discussions. Limited administrative functions. Enhanced project collaboration features.

subsections.heading: Role Boundaries
subsections.content: Cannot access individual student chat histories. Cannot modify grades or assessments. Cannot change course settings. Must respect student privacy and confidentiality.

sections.heading: Getting Started
sections.content: Steps to begin your role as a Student Assistant effectively.

subsections.heading: Role Activation
subsections.content: Your instructor will promote you to Student Assistant. You'll receive a notification of your new role. Review the additional features now available to you. Attend any training sessions provided by your instructor.

subsections.heading: Dashboard Overview
subsections.content: Access your enhanced dashboard features. View class activity summaries. Monitor help requests from students. Track your assistance contributions.

subsections.heading: Communication Setup
subsections.content: Enable notifications for student help requests. Join any Student Assistant communication channels. Coordinate with other assistants if applicable. Establish regular check-ins with your instructor.

sections.heading: Supporting Your Peers
sections.content: Best practices for providing effective peer assistance.

subsections.heading: Technical Support
subsections.content: Help students navigate the platform interface. Assist with AI model selection. Troubleshoot common technical issues. Guide students to appropriate resources.

subsections.heading: Academic Support
subsections.content: Share effective prompting techniques. Demonstrate proper AI usage for assignments. Help interpret AI responses. Encourage academic integrity practices.

subsections.heading: Study Groups
subsections.content: Organize peer learning sessions. Facilitate group discussions about AI usage. Share successful strategies and tips. Create collaborative learning opportunities.

subsections.heading: Resource Sharing
subsections.content: Compile helpful tips and guides. Share exemplary prompt examples. Create FAQ documents for common issues. Maintain a resource library for students.

sections.heading: Working with AI Tools
sections.content: Leveraging AI effectively in your assistant role.

subsections.heading: Model Expertise
subsections.content: Understand each AI model's strengths. Guide students to appropriate model choices. Demonstrate cost-effective usage. Share model-specific tips and tricks.

subsections.heading: Creating Examples
subsections.content: Develop sample prompts for common tasks. Show before/after prompt improvements. Create templates for different assignment types. Document successful interaction patterns.

subsections.heading: Troubleshooting AI Issues
subsections.content: Identify when AI responses are problematic. Help students refine unclear prompts. Recognize model limitations. Escalate complex issues to instructors.

subsections.heading: Activity Monitoring
subsections.content: Review class participation metrics. Identify students who may need help. Report usage patterns to instructors. Track common challenges and questions.

subsections.heading: Documentation
subsections.content: Maintain logs of common issues. Document solutions and workarounds. Create help guides for recurring problems. Update FAQ sections as needed.

subsections.heading: Feedback Collection
subsections.content: Gather student feedback on AI tools. Report platform issues to instructors. Suggest improvements based on peer input. Help evaluate new features or models.

sections.heading: Communication Best Practices
sections.content: Effective communication strategies for Student Assistants.

subsections.heading: With Students
subsections.content: Be approachable and patient. Provide clear, step-by-step guidance. Encourage questions and exploration. Maintain professional boundaries.

subsections.heading: With Instructors
subsections.content: Provide regular status updates. Report significant issues promptly. Share student feedback constructively. Request clarification when needed.

subsections.heading: In Groups
subsections.content: Facilitate inclusive discussions. Encourage participation from all students. Moderate respectfully and fairly. Keep conversations focused and productive.

sections.heading: Professional Development
sections.content: Growing your skills as a Student Assistant.

subsections.heading: Leadership Skills
subsections.content: Practice active listening. Develop problem-solving abilities. Build confidence in public speaking. Learn conflict resolution techniques.

subsections.heading: Technical Skills
subsections.content: Master all platform features. Stay updated on AI developments. Learn advanced prompting techniques. Understand data privacy principles.

subsections.heading: Academic Skills
subsections.content: Improve tutoring abilities. Develop teaching strategies. Enhance communication skills. Build subject matter expertise.

sections.heading: Ethics and Responsibilities
sections.content: Maintaining integrity in your assistant role.

subsections.heading: Privacy and Confidentiality
subsections.content: Never share student information. Respect individual privacy. Keep academic discussions confidential. Report concerns through proper channels.

subsections.heading: Academic Integrity
subsections.content: Model appropriate AI usage. Never complete work for other students. Encourage original thinking. Report suspected violations appropriately.

subsections.heading: Professional Conduct
subsections.content: Maintain respectful interactions. Avoid favoritism or bias. Stay within role boundaries. Seek help when uncertain.

sections.heading: Common Scenarios
sections.content: How to handle typical situations you may encounter.

subsections.heading: Student Struggles with AI
subsections.content: Start with basic navigation help. Demonstrate simple prompt examples. Break complex tasks into steps. Refer to instructor if needed.

subsections.heading: Technical Problems
subsections.content: Try basic troubleshooting first. Document the issue clearly. Report to technical support. Follow up on resolution.

subsections.heading: Academic Concerns
subsections.content: Listen without judgment. Provide appropriate resources. Maintain confidentiality. Escalate serious concerns to instructor.

subsections.heading: Time Management
subsections.content: Prioritize urgent requests. Set realistic availability hours. Delegate when appropriate. Communicate delays promptly.

sections.heading: Resources and Support
sections.content: Where to find help and additional resources.

subsections.heading: Getting Help
subsections.content: Contact your instructor for guidance. Connect with other Student Assistants. Access platform documentation. Use the Help section for reference.

subsections.heading: Training Materials
subsections.content: Review onboarding documentation. Attend training sessions. Watch tutorial videos. Practice with sample scenarios.

subsections.heading: Ongoing Support
subsections.content: Regular check-ins with instructor. Peer support from other assistants. Platform updates and announcements. Professional development opportunities.
